data.title: [PDF] Automating Customer Service using LangChain - arXiv
data.snippet: The paper explores the obsolescence of traditional customer support techniques, particularly Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs), and proposes a paradigm shift towards responsive, context-aware, and personalized customer interactions. The heart of this innovation lies in the fusion of open-source methodologies, web scraping, fine-tuning, and the seamless integration of LangChain into customer service platforms. This open-source state-of-the-art framework, presented as "Sahaay," demonstrates the ability to scale across industries and organizations, offering real-time support and query resolution. Key elements of this research encompass data collection via web scraping, the role of embeddings, the utilization of Google's Flan T5 XXL, Base and Small language models for knowledge retrieval, and [...] Submitted to the 3rd International Conference on ‚ÄúWomen in Science & Technology: Creating Sustainable Career‚Äù 28 -30 December, 2023 Automating Customer Service using LangChain Building custom open-source GPT Chatbot for organizations Keivalya Pandya 19me439@bvmengineering.ac.in Birla Vishvakarma Mahavidyalaya, Gujarat, India Prof. Dr. Mehfuza Holia msholia@bvmengineering.ac.in Birla Vishvakarma Mahavidyalaya, Gujarat, India Abstract‚Äî In the digital age, the dynamics of customer service are evolving, driven by technological advancements and the integration of Large Language Models (LLMs). This research paper introduces a groundbreaking approach to automating customer service using LangChain, a custom LLM tailored for organizations. The paper explores the obsolescence of traditional customer [...] Interactions I. INTRODUCTION ‚ÄúCustomer is king‚Äù is the ancient mantra reflecting the significance of customers in every business. In the digital age, where the rhythms of modern life are guided by the pulse of technology, the realm of customer service stands as the frontline of engagement between businesses and their clientele. It is the place where queries are answered, problems are resolved, and trust is forged. This research paper brings the future of customer service, where automation, personalization, and responsiveness converge to redefine the customer-company relationship. At the heart of this transformation lies the integration of LLMs, exemplified by LangChain . In the annals of customer service history, FAQs and traditional support mechanisms have long held sway. These venerable

data.title: [PDF] Langchain IQ: Intelligent Content and Query Processing
data.snippet: text-heavy materials that demand meticulous examination. By enabling users to pose queries related to the content of PDF documents, Abstract- The purpose of this research is to introduce and evaluate a comprehensive framework called langchain(component of Large Language Model), designed to optimize data analysis and visualization processes across various business domains. The framework integrates advanced computational techniques with user-friendly interfaces to meet the growing demand for efficient information processing tools in research and industry settings. Design/Methodology/Approach: The framework consists of three primary components: PDF answering, CSV analytics, and data visualization using the LIDA library. Integration of advanced technologies such as the Mistral 7B model for [...] AI models. The LIDA library automates the generation of insightful visualizations from processed data, enhancing data interpretation and decision-making. Originality/Value: Introducing langchain as a versatile framework that addresses the complexities of data analysis and visualization and it‚Äôs use in business analysis. Paper Type: Technical Research. Keywords- Langchain, AI, Large Language Model, Mistral 7B Model, LIDA framework Sunil Ghane. International Journal of Science, Engineering and Technology, 2024, 12:4 2 this feature aims to expedite the process of information extraction and comprehension, thereby enhancing productivity and reducing cognitive load. Secondly, the CSV analytics component addresses the intricacies of structured data analysis. With the proliferation of data-driven [...] Overall, the framework presented in this research paper represents a significant advancement in the field of data analysis and visualization. By integrating cutting-edge computational techniques with user-centric design principles, it seeks to empower individuals across domains to unlock the full potential of their data resources. In the following sections, each component of the framework will be explored in detail, highlighting its unique capabilities and potential applications in research and industry contexts II. RELATED WORKS Chatbots in Education System Vijaya Lakshmi, Y and Ishfaq Majid (2022) provide an introductory exploration of chatbot applications in educational institutions. Despite its valuable insights, it falls short of offering a specific methodology for implementation.

data.title: [PDF] Multi-PDF RAG Chatbot Using LangChain and Streamlit
data.snippet:
The paper introduces an innovative strategy for managing multi-agent systems (MASs) within autonomic computing. It focuses on leveraging large language models (LLMs), specifically GPT-based models, to enhance the adaptability and communication among agents. The study presents a new architectural framework based on the MAPE-K model, facilitating dynamic adaptation of systems. The proposed model was tested using a marketplace simulation, where autonomous agents demonstrated decision-making and adaptive behaviors using embedded LLMs. Future work aims to assign individual OpenAI accounts to each agent and explore additional real-world scenarios. The findings suggest a paradigm shift in how MASs can become more self- adaptive through LLM integration, opening up new research avenues for complex [...] 21. Patil, Dinesh D., Dhanraj R. data.title: [PDF] Knowledge Integration with LangChain in LLM - ijrti
data.snippet: ¬© 2024 IJRTI | Volume 9, Issue 4 | ISSN: 2456-3315 IJRTI2404032 International Journal for Research Trends and Innovation (www.ijrti.org) 246 Knowledge Integration with LangChain in LLM 1Suryansh Chaudhary, 2Kajal Paliwal, 3Jaivardhan Katara, 4Dr. Budesh Kanwar 1,2,3Student, 4Head of Department Department of Artificial Intelligence & Data Science Poornima Group of Institutions Jaipur, Rajasthan, India. Abstract- This research delves into the intricate realm of integrating knowledge with LangChain in the context of Large Language Models (LLMs). The primary objective is to comprehensively understand the dynamics of knowledge incorporation within LLM applications. A critical examination of past findings and research papers forms the foundation, offering insights into existing challenges. [...] Language Models (LLMs) emerges as a pivotal frontier in the advancement of artificial intelligence applications. This integration is not just about enhancing the capabilities of these models, but also about transforming the way we interact with technology, making it more intuitive and user-friendly. The proposed techniques outlined in this paper strive to directly address the challenges identified in previous research. These techniques, which include optimized index types, efficient memory management, advanced prompts, and real-time knowledge updates, lay the groundwork for the development of more effective and accurate LLM-powered solutions. They represent a significant step forward in our quest to harness the full potential of LLMs. However, it‚Äôs important to note that the field of [...] the foundation, offering insights into existing challenges. Moreover, the paper introduces innovative techniques designed to overcome identified obstacles, aiming to elevate the effectiveness of knowledge integration in LLMs. Keywords: LangChain, LLM, RAG, LLM-Index, Optimized. I. INTRODUCTION In the rapidly evolving landscape of artificial intelligence, Large Language Models (LLMs) have emerged as pivotal components in a diverse array of applications, spanning from natural language processing to automation, and even extending to areas such as data analysis and predictive modelling. These models, powered by advanced machine learning algorithms, have the ability to understand, generate, and even translate human language, thereby revolutionizing the way we interact with technology. The

data.title: Real Estate with AI: An agent based on LangChain - ScienceDirect
data.snippet:
Recent developments in large language models (LLMs) have opened new avenues for the real estate industry. These models not only understand language but also function as intelligent agents, engaging with investors through open-ended conversations and influencing their decision-making. Utilizing unstructured data from a professional Danish real estate website, we developed a real estate AI agent in both English and Danish using LangChain and Pinecone. Through testing and evaluation, our agent has demonstrated superior professional and concise outputs compared to other LLMs like Doubao and ChatGPT 4 and shown excellent performance and effectiveness. Our work serves as a reference for AI in real estate investment-related research and proposes new solutions to the "unprofessional foundation " [...] Skip to article
